newsitem.title: FRANCE: 2.5 million shrs Valeo traded - sources.
newsitem.headline: 2.5 million shrs Valeo traded - sources.

text.p: A sale of 2.5 million shares in auto parts maker Valeo, representing about 3.5 percent of the company's capital is under way, dealers said after the close of the French stock market on Wednesday.
Several sources said shares were being placed by CDC Bourse and JP Morgan.
The sources said the seller was probably either Caisse des Depots et Consignation or JP Morgan, with most saying JP Morgan the most likely.
When Cerus sold its share of Valeo, Caisse des Depots increased its share in Valeo to 5.4 percent from 1.9 percent and JP Morgan acquired 3.6 percent of the capital.
Caisse des Depots (CDC) said later it was not behind the sale.
"It is not us," a company official said in response to a query.
JP Morgan was not immediately available for comment.

Cerus, a French investment firm controlled by Italian businessman Carlo de Benedetti, said on November 5 that it sold its 28 percent share of Valeo. At the time CDC increased its share in Valeo to about 5.4 percent from 1.9 percent.
French industrial holding CGIP bought 20 percent Cerus's holding with the rest being purchased by CDC and investment fund JP Morgan GT Corp.
